name: What Remains of Me
description:
In What Remains of Me you play as Atlas, a robot that is reactivated to find itself in an abandoned, advanced AI laboratory in the depths of the ocean. Your journey through this puzzle/platformer game will have you upgrading your abilities to better traverse the dystopian landscape and defeat feral AI that stand in your way, all the while learning about the history of this post-apocalyptic world and the events that led to Atlas’s reawakening.

PLEASE NOTE: What Remains of Me logs information about your play session to our database, including you public IPv4 address and metrics about how well you were able to traverse the level. This data is collected anonymously and in a secure environment, and is used for user research purposes only. It helps us make a better game! If you do not consent to having this data collected, please refrain from playing What Remains of Me, or play the game while not connected to the internet.

This game was created by Games@Northeastern:Studio, an organization within Northeastern University, centralized at the Boston campus. It's goal is to better support students in the learning they need to succeed both academically and commercially, and to support the visibility and reputation of the collective cross-disciplinary game design and development programs at Northeastern University. Want to learn more about Games@Northeastern:Studio? Check out the official website! https://games.northeastern.edu/studio/

Interested in contributing the Games@Northeastern:Studio's user research efforts? Please take the playtesting survey! 

https://forms.gle/f6JFeDsCo6q9Ar6s5

IMPORTANT NOTE: If you are not part of an official play testing group, please choose any 10 character code to use as an ID number, and please use the same code on both the game and the play testing survey if you choose to take it!

Available for PC, MacOS, Linux. 

For best results,  use 1920x1080 (16:9) full screen resolution when playing
